intro: Labordia molokaiana var. phyllocalyx, commonly known as the Moloka`i hibiscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Moloka`i. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate and soil conditions of its native habitat. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and is a focus of conservation efforts.
